Description: Attic terracotta female figure with hair worn in a turban like sphendone. Possibly hollow, from a two piece mould, head made separately from body. Head only, broken off a complete figure at join with body. White coating preserved though no trace of original painting. Fine orange fabric with sparse fine silver mica.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Higgins gives this and a parallel from Halicarnassus (in a different fabric) an early 4th century BC date (1954, 189, pl. 93, no. 714).
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (714 bis)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 41, pl. XV, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.398) (Phase 1)
